Appear.definition: to present oneself before a person or body having authority [to before the officer who is to take the deposition " Federal Rules of Civil Procedure Rule 37
Appear.origin: [to before the officer who is to take the deposition " Federal Rules of Civil Procedure Rule 37(d)"]

1.definition: to present oneself before a person or body having authority [to before the officer who is to take the deposition "Rule 37(d)"]

sub_terms.a: to present oneself in court as a party to a lawsuit often through the representation of an attorneyto participate as a party to a lawsuit in a way other than by physical presence (as by mail)
sub_terms.b: to present oneself in court as the attorney for a party to a lawsuit [for the defendant]

2.definition: to have an outward look [conduct thatunethical]
